question: {name1} initially had {n} dozen {food}, then ate {eat} {food} for breakfast, and then hid the rest in the yard for the Easter egg hunt. {name2} finds {x} {food}. {name3} finds {mult1} as many as {name2}. {name4} finds {y} less than {name3}. {name5} finds {frac} as many as {name4}, and {name6} finds {extra} dozen {food} more than {name3} and {name2} combined. How many {food} are still hidden in the yard?
answer: (n * 12-eat)- (x + mult1 * x + (mult1 * x - y) + frac * (mult1 * x - y)+((12*extra)+x+mult1 * x))
private_constraints: is_int((n * 12-eat) - (x + mult1 * x + (mult1 * x - y) + frac * (mult1 * x - y)))
n * 12 - eat > x + mult1 * x + (mult1 * x - y) + frac * (mult1 * x - y) + ((12*extra)+x+mult1 * x)
